strongs.metadata: Strong's Greek 4771: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Strong's Greek 1161: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Strong's Greek 2980: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Strong's Greek 3739: Who, which, what, that.
Strong's Greek 4241: It becomes, is fitting to, is right. Apparently a primary verb; to tower up, i.e. to be suitable or proper.
Strong's Greek 3588: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Strong's Greek 5198: From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.
Strong's Greek 1319: Instruction, teaching. From didaskalos; instruction.
Strong's Greek 4246: An old man, an ambassador. From the same as presbuteros; an old man.
Strong's Greek 3524: Sober, not intoxicated (with wine), temperate, vigilant. Or nephalios from nepho; sober, i.e. circumspect.
Strong's Greek 1510: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Strong's Greek 4586: Venerable, honorable, grave, serious, dignified. From sebomai; venerable, i.e. Honorable.
Strong's Greek 4998: From the base of sozo and that of phren; safe in mind, i.e. Self-controlled.

Strong's Greek 3588: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

Strong's Greek 2688: Behavior, conduct, deportment, demeanor. From kathistemi; properly, a position or condition, i.e. demeanor.
Strong's Greek 2412: Suitable to a sacred character, reverent. From hieros and the same as prepo; reverent.
Strong's Greek 3361: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Strong's Greek 1228: From diaballo; a traducer; specially, Satan.

Strong's Greek 1402: To enslave. From doulos; to enslave.

Strong's Greek 2443: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
